추진방향
DX부문은 글로벌 20여개 제조사업장의 제조공정에서 용수 재이용률을 
높이기 위해 사용한 물을 오수, 폐수, 공정용수, 초순수로 분류하여 매월 
항목별 재사용 실적을 산출하고 취 수량 절감을 추진합니다. 더 나아가 
사업장에서 자연으로 돌려 보내지 못하고 부득이하게 소모한 물은 수자원 
환원 사업을 통해 지역사회로 재공급하여 수자원을 보전하고자 합니다. 
또한 협력회사를 대상으로 RBA(Responsib le Business A lliance) 
평가를 진행하고 WASH(Water, Sanitation and Hygiene) 서비스 
점검과 수자원 처 리 시설 운영 개 선 컨설팅을 제공합니다. 각 사업장 
단위로는 지자체 및 N GO, 인근 주 민 등 이해관계자와 협력체계를 
구축하여 사업장 인근 유 역의 수자원 보호와 개선 을 위해 노력하고 
있습니다.
제품에 포함될 수 있는 유해물질과 생산현장에서 사용되는 화학물질이 
고객과 임직원의 건강과 환경에 미칠 수 있는 부정적인 영향을 최소화하기 
위해 RoHS(EU 전기전자제품 내 우려물질 사용제한 지침) 과 REACH(EU 
화학물질의 등록, 평가, 허가, 제한 제도), TSCA(미국 독성물질관리법) 등 
글로벌 환경 기준을 반영해 사내 규칙을 제정하고 엄격하게 관리합니다.
리스크 관리
DX부문은 사업장이 수자원 스트 레스 또는 수자원 리스크  지역에 
위치하고 있는지 매년 검토하고, 수자원 리스크를 세분화해 분석합니다. 
세계자원연구소(WRI)의 Aqueduct Water Risk Atlas
1)
 등 국제적 수자원 
관리 기준을 적용하여 수자원 스트 레스 또는 수자원 리스크  지역을', '수행하여 자체 기준 준수 여부를 지속적으로 관리합니다. 
또한 대기, 수질 오염물질 방지시설의 여유  용량을 상시 10%  이상 
확보하여 갑작스런 오염물질 유입 증가를 사전에 대비하고, 방지시설의 
주요 장치 를 이중으로 설치 해서 고장 등 사고 발생 시에도 방지시설 
가동에 차질이 없도록 관리하고 있습니다.
우수 최 종 방류지점에는 사내 취 급물질과 사외 유 역특성에 맞춰서 
자동개폐 수문, 밸브 등 차단시설과 측정기, CCTV 등 감지시설을 설치하여 
비상시 오염물질 배출을 즉시 차단할 수 있도록 대비하고 있습니다.
지역사회 자발적 협약 참여
DX부문의 각 사업장은 지역 환경 청 주관의 자발적 협 약에 참여하여 
임직원을 포함한 지역주민의 건강과 지역 대기질 환경에 부정적 영향이 
없도록 대기 환경관리에 최선을 다하고 있습니다.
수원사업장은 수도권대기환경청 주관 ‘계절관리제 미세먼지 저감 자발적 
협약’에 참여, 고농도 미세먼지가 빈번하게 발생하는 계절관리제 기간 
(12월~다음해 3월) 동안 주요 미세먼지 물질을 법적 기준 대비 10% 이상 
자발적으로 감축하고 있습니다.
광주사업장은 영산강유역환경청 주관 ‘대기오염물질 저감 자발적 협약’에 
참여, 2024년까지 연간 배출하는 오염물질을 허용총량의 95% 미만으로 
감축할 계획입니다.
화학물질 규제가 전 세계적으로 강화되고 국가별 규제 대상과 기준이 
다양해지면서 보다 전문적인 화학물질 관리가 필요합니다. DX부문은 
제조사업장이 위치한 중국, 베트남, 인도 등 총 16개국의 화학물질 법규 
데이터 베이스를 주기적으로 업데 이트하고, 자체 관리 기준과 통합  
관리하여 관련 리스크를 최소화하고 있습니다.
또한 임직원이 사용하고자 하는 화학제품 내 사내규제물질 함유 여부를 
쉽게 인지하고 완성검사까지 실시할 수 있도록 시스템 을 개선하는 등 
삼성전자 화학물질 관리 연혁 프로세스를 강화하여 운영하고 있습니다.

reference: Samsung Electronics is advancing 친환경 패키지 개발 by expanding the use of 자원순환형 포장재 in its DX부문. Specifically, the company has developed innovative technology to recycle marine plastic waste such as discarded fishing nets and plans to continuously increase the use of recycled materials like recycled aluminum and recycled glass. For example, the Galaxy S24 series packaging uses 100% recycled paper for the box and protective covers. Additionally, Samsung is working on a mid-to-long-term roadmap to apply recycled resin to plastic parts in products, aiming to increase from 25% to 50%, and eventually to 100%. The company also plans to establish a circular economy research institute and has built a recycling system for minerals extracted from all collected waste batteries. These initiatives collectively demonstrate Samsung's commitment to 친환경 패키지 개발 through 자원순환형 포장재 사용.
response:
Samsung Electronics is advancing 친환경 패키지 개발 (eco-friendly package development) in its DX부문 by promoting the use of 자원순환형 포장재 (circular packaging materials). Specific initiatives supporting this effort include:

- Expanding the use of recycled and recyclable materials such as recycled aluminum and glass.
- Developing innovative recycling technologies, for example, recycling discarded fishing nets to address plastic waste issues.
- Setting targets to apply recycled resin to 50% of plastic parts in products purchased by the DX부문 by 2030, and to 100% of plastic parts by 2050.
- Operating a global e-waste collection and recycling system in over 70 countries, with plans to expand to 180 countries by 2030, aiming to collect 10 million tons of e-waste by 2030 and 25 million tons by 2050.
- Establishing the Circular Economy Research Institute in July 2022 to research recycling materials and technologies, aiming to replace all product materials with recycled materials through collaboration with domestic and international research institutions and companies.

These initiatives collectively support Samsung Electronics' commitment to enhancing resource circulation and minimizing environmental impact through eco-friendly packaging development in the DX부문.

DX부문은 원 료부터 생산/폐기/재활용까지 제품의 모 든 주기에 걸 쳐 
자원순환성을 높이는 과제를 하고 있습니다. 재활용 소재로 제품을 만들고 
다 쓴 제품을 수거해 자원을 추출한 뒤 다시 이를 제품의 재료로 사용하는 
‘자원 순환 체계’를 추구합니다. 또한 제품을 더 오래 쓸 수 있는 방법을 
연구하고 적용하여 제품이 환경에 미치는 영향을 최소화하고자 합니다. 
이를 위해 일부 제품에서는 내구성, 수리 용이성을 높이고, 주기적인 
소프트웨어 업그레이드를 지원하며, 삼성 케어 플러스(Samsung Care+) 
프로그램을 통해 파손, 수리에 대한 소비자 부담을 덜어주고 제품 수명 
연장에 기여합니다.

폐제품 수거 체계 운영 
DX부문은 한국을 포 함한 전 세계 70여 개국에서 브랜드에 관계 없이 
폐제품을 수거하기 위해 다양한 재활용 프로그램을 운영하고 있습니다. 
국가별 특성을 고려해 리사이클링센터를 직접 운영하거나 재활용 협회 
또는 재활용 업체와 협업해 폐전자제품 회수/재활용 프로그램을 운영하고 
있습니다.
2009년부터 2023년까지 누적 629.7만 톤의 폐전자제품을 회수했습니다. 
앞으로 2030년까지 제품을 판매하고 있는 모든 나라인 180여 개국으로 
폐제품 수거 체계를 확대하고, 2009년부터 누적으로 2030년 1,000만 톤, 
2050년 2,500만 톤의 폐전자제품을 수거할 계획입니다.

DX부문은 자원순환 극대화를 위해 2022년 7월 소재 재활용 및 기술과 
제품 적용을 연구하는 조직인 ‘순환경제연구소 ’를 설립 했습니다. 
순환경제연구소는 재활용 소재 개발, 폐기물 자원화 기술 연구 등을 통해

제품 및 제조과정 우려물질 관리 
DX부문은 에 코파트너 인증 심사를 통해 공급망의 오염물질 사용을 
관리하여 협력회사들 이 환경경영 활동에 적극 참여할 수 있도록 
독려하고 있습니다. 협력회사는 원재료  업체에서 받 은 데이터와 
우려물질 정보를 증명하는 제품환경보증서 등을 삼성전자에 제출합니다. 
삼성전자는 ‘제품환경 관리물질 운영규 칙’ 준수 여부와 협력회사 
환경품질관리시스 템을 심사해 인증자격을 부여하고, 인증을 취득 한 
협력회사에 한해 거래하고 있습니다.
제품 내 우려물질 관리 
수자원 환원 사업 추진
DX부문의 제품 생산과정에는 물이 필수적으로 사용되고 사용된 물은 
깨끗하게 정화하여 다시 자연으로 돌려 보내지만 필연적으로 일부의 물은 
소모되게 됩니다. DX부문은 소모한 물의 양만큼 지역사회에 돌려주는 
‘2030년 수자원 환원 100%’라는 목표를 수립했습니다. 이러한 수자원 
환원 프로젝트를 통해 이해관계자, 지역사회에 가용 수자원을 돌려주어 
환경 영향을 최소화 하고 있습니다. 2023년 한국농어촌공사와 업무협약
(MOU)을 체결 하여 물 부족 을 겪는 도서지역에 농업용수 재이용을 
지원하는 시범사업을 진행했고, 2024년에는 국내 뿐만 아니라 해외 제조 
사업장에서도 환원 사업을 발굴하여 수자원 보전에 기여할 계획입니다. 
DX부문 수자원 환원 현황 
오염물질 배출 최소화와 사고 대비
DX부문은 제품 생산과정에서 발생하는 대기, 수질 오염물질의 배출을 
최소화 하기 위해,  법적기준 및 엄격한 내부기준을 적용하고 있으며 각

수행하여 자체 기준 준수 여부를 지속적으로 관리합니다.

추진방향
DX부문은 글로벌 20여개 제조사업장의 제조공정에서 용수 재이용률을 
높이기 위해 사용한 물을 오수, 폐수, 공정용수, 초순수로 분류하여 매월 
항목별 재사용 실적을 산출하고 취 수량 절감을 추진합니다. 더 나아가 
사업장에서 자연으로 돌려 보내지 못하고 부득이하게 소모한 물은 수자원 
환원 사업을 통해 지역사회로 재공급하여 수자원을 보전하고자 합니다. 
또한 협력회사를 대상으로 RBA(Responsib le Business A lliance) 
평가를 진행하고 WASH(Water, Sanitation and Hygiene) 서비스 
점검과 수자원 처 리 시설 운영 개 선 컨설팅을 제공합니다. 각 사업장 
단위로는 지자체 및 N GO, 인근 주 민 등 이해관계자와 협력체계를 
구축하여 사업장 인근 유 역의 수자원 보호와 개선 을 위해 노력하고 
있습니다.
제품에 포함될 수 있는 유해물질과 생산현장에서 사용되는 화학물질이 
고객과 임직원의 건강과 환경에 미칠 수 있는 부정적인 영향을 최소화하기 
위해 RoHS(EU 전기전자제품 내 우려물질 사용제한 지침) 과 REACH(EU 
화학물질의 등록, 평가, 허가, 제한 제도), TSCA(미국 독성물질관리법) 등 
글로벌 환경 기준을 반영해 사내 규칙을 제정하고 엄격하게 관리합니다.
리스크 관리

리스크 관리
DX부문은 자원순환 리스크를 위험 인식, 평가, 처리, 성과 관리의 4단계로 
정의하고 있습니다. 자원순환과 관련된 위 험 요인은 폐기물 처리 비용 
증가, 처리 시설 및 기술 한계, 소비자 인식  부족 등이고, 플라스틱 등 
재활용을 통한 폐기물 감소와 재활용 기술 개발을 통한 새로운 시장 개척 
등은 기회 요인으로 인식하고 있습니다.

3 각 위험에 대한 대응책 마련, 실행, 모니터링
2 식별된 위험의 우선 순위를 지정

reference: The DX division is responsible for increasing the reuse rate of water in manufacturing processes across over 20 global manufacturing sites by categorizing used water into sewage, wastewater, process water, and ultrapure water, and calculating monthly reuse performance by category to promote water intake reduction. They also implement water resource replenishment projects to supply water back to local communities, conserving water resources. Additionally, the DX division conducts RBA evaluations for partner companies and provides consulting to improve water, sanitation, hygiene services, and water treatment facility operations. Regarding 수자원 리스크, the DX division annually reviews whether manufacturing sites are located in areas of water stress or water risk, analyzing these risks in detail using international water management standards such as the World Resources Institute's Aqueduct Water Risk Atlas. These efforts are integrated into the company’s 환경경영전략, which is overseen by the board of directors and the Sustainability Management Committee. The CEO of the DX division holds responsibility and authority for establishing and implementing the environmental management strategy, including water management, and leads cross-functional teams to execute and monitor these plans. Since 2021, water management has been incorporated into organizational and executive performance evaluations, with plans to expand sustainability elements in future assessments.
response:
The DX division has several key roles and responsibilities in managing water reuse and conservation as part of the company’s environmental management strategy (환경경영전략):

1. Water Reuse and Conservation Management:
- The DX division operates under the product environmental management substance operation rules to ensure compliance with regulations on hazardous substances.
- It manages water resources systematically across all global manufacturing sites by installing water-saving facilities and treating wastewater to increase the reuse of reclaimed water.
- The division classifies used water into categories such as sewage, wastewater, process water, and ultrapure water, and calculates monthly reuse performance by category to promote water intake reduction.
- It actively seeks additional reuse applications for reclaimed water and utilizes groundwater and rainwater for landscaping and domestic use to reduce water consumption.
- The DX division pursues water resource conservation by returning water to local communities through water resource replenishment projects, aiming for 100% global water use replenishment by 2030.
- It provides consulting and evaluation services (e.g., RBA evaluation, WASH service inspection) to partner companies to improve water resource management.

2. Addressing 수자원 리스크 (Water Resource Risks):
- The DX division annually reviews whether manufacturing sites are located in water-stressed or water-risk areas using international standards such as the World Resources Institute (WRI) Aqueduct Water Risk Atlas and CDP Water Guidance methodology.
- It segments and analyzes water resource risks and establishes response strategies accordingly.
- Key risk response strategies include installing water storage tanks and reuse facilities to prepare for droughts, renewing disaster insurance annually, and conducting emergency response training to prepare for floods.
- The division manages discharge water quality according to legal and strict internal standards.
- It raises awareness among employees about the importance of water resources through activities such as participation in World Water Day.
- The DX division collaborates with local governments, NGOs, and nearby residents to protect and improve water resources in the vicinity of manufacturing sites.

Overall, the DX division integrates water reuse and conservation efforts with risk management strategies to ensure sustainable water resource use and minimize environmental impact as part of the company’s environmental management strategy.

reference: Samsung Electronics constructs its value chain from upstream suppliers (raw materials, components) through its own operations (manufacturing, sales) to downstream activities (transportation, sales, repair/service), identifying key stakeholders and industry activities at each stage. Using the Sustainability Accounting Standards Board (SASB) standards, the company analyzes ESG issues by industry and derives major ESG issues for each segment and business unit within the value chain. To ensure comprehensive stakeholder input, Samsung identifies key stakeholder groups such as employees, customers, partners, government and regulatory bodies, investors, NGOs, and international organizations, and plans diverse opinion collection methods including surveys and interviews. Furthermore, Samsung reflects the characteristics of each business division, such as DX/DS divisions, by constructing separate value chains and identifying division-specific stakeholders. For issue evaluation, Samsung compiles an issue pool of 115 topics by adding 23 industry-specific issues to the 92 subtopics from the EU's ESRS standards. These issues are then evaluated against four criteria: alignment with company strategy, linkage to global initiatives, relevance to industry peers, and value chain analysis results. This process results in 52 prioritized issues grouped into 13 overarching ESG themes. Subsequently, Samsung assesses the environmental and social impacts, as well as financial risks and opportunities, of these 13 ESG themes by analyzing regulations, media, sustainability reports, and stakeholder demands, focusing on how related business activities within the value chain affect the environment and society.
response:
Samsung Electronics analyzes and derives ESG issues across its value chain through a structured multi-step process:

1. **Understanding the Business and Value Chain Analysis**: Samsung first comprehensively understands its business by analyzing both internal and external environments, including company disclosures and stakeholder inquiries. It constructs the value chain covering upstream (raw materials, suppliers), internal operations (manufacturing, sales), and downstream (transportation, sales, repair/service) stages. For each stage, it identifies key stakeholders and their industry sectors and business activities.

2. **ESG Issue Identification Using Standards**: Samsung references the Sustainability Accounting Standards Board (SASB) criteria and incorporates industry-specific ESG issues. It also integrates 92 subtopics from the European Sustainability Reporting Standards (ESRS), adding 23 industry-specific issues to form a pool of 115 ESG issues.

3. **Impact, Risk, and Opportunity Identification**: For the initially identified ESG topics, Samsung assesses environmental and social impacts, classifying them as positive or negative, actual or potential. It analyzes how these impacts affect the company financially, categorizing them into risks and opportunities. This includes evaluating the scale, geographic and physical scope, correctability, and likelihood of environmental/social impacts, as well as the quantitative and qualitative financial magnitude and timing of risks and opportunities.

4. **Stakeholder Engagement and Evaluation**: Samsung conducts extensive stakeholder engagement, including surveys and interviews with employees, customers, partners, investors, NGOs, and international organizations. It provides guidance and explanatory materials to ensure understanding. It also holds forums with EU stakeholders to discuss sustainability performance and regulatory trends.

5. **Evaluation Based on Specific Criteria**: Using the EU ESRS requirements, Samsung designs evaluation scales to assess each ESG issue's relevance based on four criteria: alignment with company strategy, linkage to global initiatives, relevance to industry peers, and results from value chain analysis. Both quantitative and qualitative analyses are performed, including management interviews.

6. **Deriving Material ESG Issues**: From the evaluation, Samsung narrows down the issues to 52 and further consolidates them into 13 higher-level topics. Finally, it selects 8 material ESG topics covering environmental, social, and governance areas, such as climate change and energy, water resources, resource circulation and waste, employee working conditions, supply chain, information security, product quality and safety, and ethical management.

Through this comprehensive process, Samsung Electronics systematically analyzes ESG issues across its value chain and evaluates them based on detailed environmental and social impact assessments, financial risk and opportunity evaluations, and broad stakeholder input.

유럽재무보고자문 그룹(EFRAG: European Financia l Reportin g

영향을 모두 고려하였습니다.

reference: 삼성전자의 추진체계는 최고 의사결정기구인 이사회와 지속가능경영위원회가 기후변화 대응을 기업의 핵심 경영 영역으로 인식하고 이를 관장하는 구조로 구성되어 있습니다. 이사회는 환경경영전략과 목표를 승인하고 주요 활동을 감독하며, DX부문 CEO가 환경경영전략 수립과 이행 과제 발굴, 투자 등을 책임집니다. 전사 지속가능경영협의회와 환경경영TF는 환경경영 계획 수립과 이행 성과 점검을 담당합니다. 특히, 환경경영 TF는 탄소공시협의체와 에코협의회, 환경안전 회의를 통해 탄소배출량 산정 기준 수립 및 시스템 구축을 수행하며, 온실가스 배출량 및 감축 과제 관리와 감독을 담당합니다. 이러한 추진체계와 시스템 구축을 바탕으로 삼성전자는 DX부문 사업장 재생에너지 100% 전환 추진, 무공해차 전환, 고효율 제품 개발 등 다양한 기후변화 대응 활동을 전개하여 2023년에는 탄소중립(Scope 1, 2) 달성을 추진하고 있습니다.
response: 삼성전자는 기후변화 대응 전략의 일환으로 탄소배출량 산정 및 시스템 구축을 추진체계에 통합하여 탄소중립 달성을 목표로 하고 있습니다. 구체적으로, 2019년 CDP 공급망 프로그램 가입을 시작으로 2022년 온실가스 감축을 위한 운영체계를 정립하였으며, 협력회사가 온실가스 배출량을 산정하고 감축목표를 수립할 수 있도록 가이드라인을 개발하여 교육하고 단계별 지원 프로그램을 운영하고 있습니다. 또한, DX부문과 DS부문은 각각 2030년과 2050년까지 Scope 1, 2 탄소 순배출 제로화를 목표로 공정 에너지 효율 제고, 재생에너지 사용 확대, 공정가스 처리시설 증설 등 다양한 온실가스 감축 과제를 추진하고 있습니다. 이를 통해 삼성전자는 전 밸류체인에 걸쳐 체계적인 탄소배출량 산정과 감축 시스템을 구축하여 탄소중립을 실현하고 있습니다.

reference: Samsung Electronics plans to achieve carbon neutrality by 2030 by minimizing direct greenhouse gas emissions through improving energy efficiency in processes and expanding the use of renewable energy. They are also implementing various greenhouse gas reduction initiatives across the entire value chain, including logistics, sales, and product usage. Regarding risk management, the increase in carbon credit prices is recognized as a short-term risk that could raise investment costs. However, Samsung views securing external carbon credits as a way to mitigate sensitivity to carbon pricing, while adopting energy-efficient equipment helps reduce energy costs. These strategies are part of their broader approach to managing financial and strategic risks related to climate change, including regulatory tightening and market changes.
response:
Samsung plans to achieve carbon neutrality by 2030 by minimizing direct greenhouse gas emissions through improving energy efficiency in their processes and expanding the use of renewable energy. They are also implementing various greenhouse gas reduction initiatives across the entire value chain, including product logistics, sales, and usage.

Regarding risk management, the increase in carbon credit prices is considered a potential short-term risk. This price rise, along with increased investment costs for adopting high-efficiency energy technologies and expenses related to responding to extreme weather events, poses financial challenges. However, Samsung also views securing external carbon credits as a way to mitigate sensitivity to carbon prices and recognizes energy cost savings from high-efficiency equipment as an opportunity.

DS부문은 기후변화 관련 국가별 규제 리스크· 기회를 파악하여 전사 
리스크 관리 체계에 통합 하여 관리합니다. 관리 대상인 리스크·기회는 
비즈니스와 평 판에 영 향을 줄 수 있는 국가별 규제 및 시장 변화를 
포함하며, 파악된 리스크·기회는 관련 환경경영 협의체를 통해 경영진에게 
보고됩니다.
기후변화 리스크·기회의 재무적 영향 분석

기후변화가 미래 재무영 향에 미 치는 영 향에 대해  파 일럿 분 석을 
실시했습니다. 기후변화로 인한 리스크와 기회요인을 식별하는 것은 향후 
새로운 사업 창출과 신시장 진입에 중요하므로, 기후변화의 물리적·전환 
리스크 요인을 식별하고 이에 따른 재무 영향을 분석하였습니다.
그 결과 DS부문의 주요 물리적 리스크 요인으로는 폭염, 태풍, 해안침수가 
도출되었습니다. 이 중 반도체 생산에 큰 영향을 미칠 수 있는 태풍에 
대비하기 위해, 시설 건 설시 내 풍 기준을 역대 최고 풍 속 수준으로 
수립하고 차수막을 설치한 바 있습니다. DS부문은 향후 라인 증설 및

reference: Samsung Electronics practices 사회적 책임 by actively engaging with various stakeholders through corporate social responsibility initiatives and transparent communication. According to the context, Samsung ensures responsible corporate citizenship by maintaining open and swift disclosure of relevant information via its sustainability management website and conducting diverse activities such as stakeholder forums, surveys, and site visits to share sustainability performance and gather feedback. Furthermore, Samsung participates in NGO and civil society meetings, including corporate meetings, NGO meetings, stakeholder forums, and workshops on labor rights, contributing to collaboration across industries and addressing climate response aligned with the UN SDGs. These efforts demonstrate Samsung's commitment to social responsibility by fostering cooperation with NGOs, civil society, and other stakeholders to enhance sustainable management and stakeholder engagement.
response:
Samsung Electronics practices 사회적 책임 (social responsibility) through active stakeholder engagement by conducting meetings and forums with NGOs and civil society organizations. In March 2024, Samsung held a sustainability management forum in Brussels, Belgium, titled 'Innovate & Empower: Samsung’s Sustainability Journey,' which included participation from various EU government agencies, international organizations such as ILO, OECD, UNDP, UNEP, UNGC, UN PRI, and associations like RBA, WBCSD, and GRI. Through these meetings, Samsung shared its sustainability management achievements and gathered requests and feedback from European and global stakeholders. 

Additionally, Samsung conducts online surveys involving internal employees, customers, partners, investors, NGOs, and international organizations to collect diverse opinions. They also hold interviews with executives related to sustainability management to understand important ESG topics. These activities enable Samsung to incorporate stakeholder feedback into their sustainability initiatives and continuously communicate their progress, thereby fulfilling their social responsibility.

reference: DS부문 manages 환경경영 전략 through a structured sustainability management system where the 최고 의사결정기구인 이사회 산하 지속가능경영위원회 approves and oversees the environmental management strategies and goals at the company-wide level, including DS부문의 activities. The ESG경영협의회, led by the DS부문 head, reviews these strategies, goals, and performance. Additionally, the 지속가능경영회의 and 탄소중립위원회, chaired by the 경영지원실장 and 제조&기술담당 respectively, make decisions on detailed strategies to ensure continuous implementation of environmental initiatives. These decisions guide specialized working committees focused on carbon, pollutants, waste, and water resources to establish detailed tasks and monitor execution. Regarding 기후변화 관련 국가별 규제 리스크 및 기회, DS부문 identifies and integrates these risks and opportunities into the company-wide risk management system. These include regulatory and market changes that could impact business and reputation. The identified risks and opportunities are reported to management through relevant environmental management councils. For example, physical risks such as heatwaves, typhoons, and coastal flooding have been analyzed, leading to measures like setting construction wind standards to the highest recorded speeds and installing flood barriers. Transition risks, such as increased costs from greenhouse gas emissions, are addressed by investments like expanding Regenerative Catalytic System (RCS) facilities. This integrated governance and risk management approach strengthens DS부문's environmental management strategy and sustainability management.

DS부문은 환경경영 전략과 기후변화 관련 국가별 규제 리스크 및 기회를 지속가능경영위원회와 탄소중립위원회를 통해 체계적으로 관리하고 있습니다. 

먼저, 최고 의사결정기구인 이사회 산하 지속가능경영위원회에서 DS부문의 환경경영 전략과 목표를 승인하고 주요 활동을 감독하며 의사결정을 실시합니다. DS부문 부문장이 주관하는 ESG경영협의회에서는 환경경영 전략, 목표 및 성과를 검토합니다. 또한, 경영지원실장 주관의 지속가능경영회의와 제조&기술담당 주관의 탄소중립위원회는 환경전략이 지속적으로 추진될 수 있도록 세부 전략에 대해 의사결정을 합니다.

기후변화 관련 국가별 규제 리스크와 기회는 전사 리스크 관리 체계에 통합되어 관리되며, 관련 환경경영 협의체를 통해 경영진에게 보고됩니다. DS부문은 기후변화 리스크·기회의 재무적 영향 분석을 통해 주요 물리적 리스크(폭염, 태풍, 해안침수)와 전환 리스크(온실가스 배출량 증가에 따른 비용 증가)를 식별하고, 이에 대응하기 위해 시설 건설 시 내풍 기준을 최고 수준으로 설정하고 공정가스 처리시설(RCS) 증설 등 지속적인 투자를 진행하고 있습니다.

따라서, 지속가능경영위원회는 전사 차원의 환경경영 전략 승인과 감독 역할을, 탄소중립위원회는 탄소 관련 세부 사안 협의 및 의사결정 역할을 수행하며, DS부문은 이들 위원회를 중심으로 환경경영 전략과 기후변화 관련 규제 리스크 및 기회를 체계적으로 관리하고 있습니다.

reference: Based on the Aqueduct Water Risk Atlas, 수자원 리스크 대응 전략 수립 및 이행 involves identifying water risk areas using international water management standards and the CDP Water Guidance methodology. Key strategies include installing and operating water storage tanks and reuse facilities to prepare for droughts, renewing disaster insurance annually to mitigate flood risks, establishing emergency response systems with regular drills, and managing discharge water quality according to legal and strict internal standards. The DX부문 implements 체계적인 수자원 관리 by segmenting water management at global manufacturing sites to reduce water use and promote reuse, achieving AWS water management system certification, and pursuing water replenishment projects with a goal of 100% water use replenishment by 2030. To minimize 오염물질 배출, the DX부문 applies legal and stricter internal standards to control air and water pollutants, frequently analyzes emissions and wastewater beyond legal requirements, and maintains pollution prevention facilities with at least 10% spare capacity. Additionally, through 리스크 평가 및 분석, the DX부문 conducts risk assessments on all hazardous and harmful substances handled in new facilities or process changes, analyzing the likelihood, impact, and control measures of risks, and predicting possible accident scenarios and their effects. These comprehensive efforts ensure systematic water resource management and pollution minimization in their manufacturing processes.
response:
Based on the Aqueduct Water Risk Atlas, the 수자원 리스크 대응 전략 수립 및 이행 (water resource risk response strategy establishment and implementation) measures include:

1. Installing and operating water storage tanks and reuse facilities to prepare for droughts.
2. Renewing disaster compensation insurance annually and establishing an emergency response system with regular training to prepare for floods.
3. Managing discharge water quality according to legal and strict internal standards.
4. Enhancing awareness of water resource importance among employees by participating in activities such as World Water Day.

The DX부문 implements 체계적인 수자원 관리 (systematic water resource management) and 오염물질 배출 최소화 (minimization of pollutant discharge) through 리스크 평가 및 분석 (risk assessment and analysis) in their manufacturing processes by:

1. Conducting risk assessments on all hazardous/risky materials handled in new facilities or when changing personnel, process layout, work procedures, or conditions, considering the likelihood, consequences, influencing factors, and control measures.
2. Analyzing risks and predicting possible accident scenarios and their impacts.
3. Installing water-saving facilities at all manufacturing sites and discovering additional reuse points for treated wastewater to reduce water intake and increase reuse rates.
4. Utilizing groundwater and rainwater for landscaping and living water to promote water conservation.
5. Applying international water management standards and continuously reviewing whether manufacturing sites are located in water-stressed or water-risk areas.
6. Maintaining more than 10% spare capacity in air and water pollution prevention facilities and installing redundant key devices to ensure continuous operation during failures.
7. Installing automatic gates, valves, sensors, and CCTV at final discharge points to immediately block pollutant discharge in emergencies.
8. Participating in voluntary local environmental agreements to manage air quality and minimize negative impacts on local communities.

These comprehensive measures ensure effective water resource risk management and pollution control in DX부문's manufacturing processes.

없도록 대기 환경관리에 최선을 다하고 있습니다.
수원사업장은 수도권대기환경청 주관 ‘계절관리제 미세먼지 저감 자발적 
협약’에 참여, 고농도 미세먼지가 빈번하게 발생하는 계절관리제 기간 
(12월~다음해 3월) 동안 주요 미세먼지 물질을 법적 기준 대비 10% 이상 
자발적으로 감축하고 있습니다.
광주사업장은 영산강유역환경청 주관 ‘대기오염물질 저감 자발적 협약’에

감축할 계획입니다.
화학물질 규제가 전 세계적으로 강화되고 국가별 규제 대상과 기준이 
다양해지면서 보다 전문적인 화학물질 관리가 필요합니다. DX부문은 
제조사업장이 위치한 중국, 베트남, 인도 등 총 16개국의 화학물질 법규 
데이터 베이스를 주기적으로 업데 이트하고, 자체 관리 기준과 통합  
관리하여 관련 리스크를 최소화하고 있습니다.

reference: Samsung Electronics' DX division enhances water reuse and conservation by categorizing used water into sewage, wastewater, process water, and ultrapure water, calculating monthly reuse performance for each category, and promoting reductions in water intake. When water cannot be returned to nature and is inevitably consumed, the division undertakes water resource replenishment projects to supply water back to local communities, thereby conserving water resources. Additionally, the DX division conducts Responsible Business Alliance (RBA) evaluations for partner companies and provides consulting to improve water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) services and water treatment facility operations. The division also collaborates with local governments, NGOs, and nearby residents to protect and improve water resources in surrounding areas. To manage 수자원 리스크, the DX division annually reviews whether business sites are located in water-stressed or water-risk areas, applying international water management standards such as the World Resources Institute's Aqueduct Water Risk Atlas to analyze and segment water risks. These water reuse and risk management activities are integrated into Samsung Electronics' broader 환경경영 전략 and ESG management framework. Governance bodies including the ESG경영협의회 and the 지속가능경영위원회 oversee environmental strategies, goals, and performance. The ESG경영협의회 reviews environmental management strategies and outcomes, while the 지속가능경영위원회, under the board of directors, supervises sustainability directions and implementation results, including water resource management. Detailed environmental strategies are decided through meetings such as the 지속가능경영회의 and 탄소중립위원회, which ensure continuous pursuit of environmental goals. Furthermore, environmental working committees focused on carbon, pollutants, waste, and water establish detailed tasks and monitor execution. This governance structure ensures that water reuse, conservation, and 수자원 리스크 management are systematically embedded within Samsung Electronics' sustainability management and environmental governance.
response:
Samsung Electronics' DX division implements water reuse and conservation strategies by classifying used water from manufacturing processes into categories such as wastewater, process water, and ultrapure water, and calculating monthly reuse performance for each category to promote water intake reduction. They also engage in water resource replenishment projects to return the amount of water consumed back to local communities, aiming for a "100% water resource replenishment by 2030." For example, in 2023, they signed an MOU with the Korea Rural Community Corporation to support agricultural water reuse in water-scarce island regions and plan to expand such projects domestically and internationally.

To manage water-related risks (수자원 리스크), the DX division annually reviews whether manufacturing sites are located in water-stressed or water-risk areas, using international standards such as the World Resources Institute's Aqueduct Water Risk Atlas to analyze and segment water risks. They also collaborate with local governments, NGOs, and nearby residents to protect and improve water resources around their sites.

These water management efforts are integrated into Samsung Electronics' overall environmental management (환경경영 전략) and ESG management frameworks. The company's highest decision-making bodies, including the Board of Directors and the Sustainability Management Committee (지속가능경영위원회), recognize climate change and resource circulation as core business and financial performance areas, approving environmental strategies and overseeing key activities. The DX division CEO holds responsibility and authority for establishing and implementing environmental strategies, supported by cross-functional bodies such as the Sustainability Management Council (지속가능경영협의회) and the Environmental Management Task Force (환경경영TF), which plan and monitor environmental initiatives.

Since 2021, the DX division has incorporated greenhouse gas reduction achievements into organizational evaluations and, from 2023, added metrics such as renewable energy transition, high-efficiency product development, and waste recycling performance. In 2024, water management indicators were included in performance evaluations, reflecting the company's commitment to expanding sustainability elements in organizational and executive assessments. This governance structure ensures that water reuse and conservation strategies are systematically managed and aligned with Samsung Electronics' broader ESG and environmental goals.

reference: The DX부문 is prioritizing 온실가스 직접배출 감축 by focusing on 에너지 절감 and energy efficiency improvement through several key activities. These include enhancing energy efficiency at business sites, implementing energy-saving and energy transition initiatives, and setting reduction targets such as a 10% decrease in energy use compared to the previous year. Specific measures involve replacing high-efficiency equipment, applying IoT systems for automation, optimizing heating and cooling operations, and improving LNG usage efficiency. Additionally, the DX부문 collaborates with global reduction project experts and pursues external reduction projects like afforestation and mangrove restoration to secure emission reduction credits. These efforts are reflected in the 2023 environmental achievements, where the DX부문 reached 93.4% renewable energy use, advanced the transition of domestic business vehicles to 100% zero-emission electric and hydrogen vehicles, and improved energy efficiency of seven representative product models by an average of 25% compared to 2019. The DX부문 is actively pursuing carbon neutrality (Scope 1 and 2) through these integrated 에너지 절감 and energy efficiency improvement strategies.
response:
The DX부문 is implementing several specific energy-saving activities and energy efficiency improvement measures to achieve its 온실가스 직접배출 감축 (direct greenhouse gas emission reduction) goals. These include:

1. Replacing high-efficiency equipment and improving manufacturing process efficiency to reduce energy consumption.
2. Optimizing the operation of heating and cooling facilities to save energy.
3. Applying IoT systems and automation to enhance energy efficiency.
4. Improving LNG usage efficiency to reduce energy use at business sites.
5. Collaborating with global emission reduction specialized organizations.
6. Developing and expanding external emission reduction projects such as afforestation and mangrove restoration to secure emission reduction credits.
7. Setting reduction targets based on the previous year's energy consumption and continuously working on energy reduction activities at global manufacturing sites.

These efforts align with the 2023 environmental achievements, which include:

- Achieving 93.4% renewable energy usage in DX부문 business sites.
- Pursuing 100% renewable energy transition in DX부문 business sites.
- Applying energy high-efficiency technology to representative models of seven major products, improving energy consumption by an average of 25% compared to 2019.
- Promoting the transition of domestic business-use vehicles to 100% zero-emission vehicles (electric/hydrogen) by 2027.
- Working towards carbon neutrality (Scope 1 and 2) in the DX부문.

Overall, the DX부문's energy-saving and efficiency improvement measures are integral to its strategy to minimize direct greenhouse gas emissions and achieve carbon neutrality by 2030, consistent with its 2023 environmental performance and future goals.

reference: Samsung Electronics' DX division actively promotes water reuse and conservation by classifying used water into categories such as wastewater, process water, and ultrapure water, and tracking monthly reuse performance to reduce water intake across over 20 global manufacturing sites. They also implement water resource replenishment projects to return water to local communities, thereby conserving water resources. To manage 수자원 리스크, the DX division annually reviews whether their sites are located in water-stressed or water-risk areas, using international standards like the World Resources Institute's Aqueduct Water Risk Atlas to analyze and address these risks. In terms of circular economy, Samsung Electronics pursues a resource circulation system that spans from raw materials to production, disposal, and recycling. They collect used products to extract resources and reuse them as materials for new products. Specifically, they operate e-Waste collection and recycling systems in over 70 countries, aiming to expand to 180 countries by 2030 and collect 10 million tons of e-Waste by then, increasing to 25 million tons by 2050. This e-Waste recycling effort is a key component of their circular economy strategy, reducing environmental impact and promoting sustainable resource use.
response:
Samsung Electronics' DX division integrates water reuse and conservation efforts with managing 수자원 리스크 (water resource risks) through a comprehensive approach. They classify the water used in manufacturing processes into categories such as wastewater, process water, and ultrapure water, and calculate monthly reuse performance for each category to promote water reuse and reduce intake. Additionally, they implement water resource replenishment projects to return the amount of water consumed back to local communities, thereby conserving water resources. The DX division annually reviews whether their manufacturing sites are located in areas with water stress or water resource risks, using international standards like the World Resources Institute's Aqueduct Water Risk Atlas to analyze and manage these risks in detail. They also collaborate with local governments, NGOs, and nearby residents to protect and improve water resources in the vicinity of their sites.

Regarding 폐전자제품 (e-Waste) 수거 및 재활용 (collection and recycling), it plays a crucial role in Samsung Electronics' circular economy strategy. The DX division operates e-waste collection and recycling programs in over 70 countries, regardless of brand, either by directly managing recycling centers or partnering with recycling associations and companies. Since 2009, they have collected a cumulative total of 6.297 million tons of e-waste and plan to expand the collection system to 180 countries by 2030, aiming to collect 10 million tons by 2030 and 25 million tons by 2050. This e-waste collection system supports the circular economy by ensuring that materials extracted from used products are recycled and reused as raw materials for new products, thereby maximizing resource circulation and minimizing environmental impact.

Water & Pollution

추진방향
DX부문은 글로벌 20여개 제조사업장의 제조공정에서 용수 재이용률을 
높이기 위해 사용한 물을 오수, 폐수, 공정용수, 초순수로 분류하여 매월 
항목별 재사용 실적을 산출하고 취 수량 절감을 추진합니다. 더 나아가 
사업장에서 자연으로 돌려 보내지 못하고 부득이하게 소모한 물은 수자원 
환원 사업을 통해 지역사회로 재공급하여 수자원을 보전하고자 합니다. 
또한 협력회사를 대상으로 RBA(Responsib le Business A lliance) 
평가를 진행하고 WASH(Water, Sanitation and Hygiene) 서비스 
점검과 수자원 처 리 시설 운영 개 선 컨설팅을 제공합니다. 각 사업장 
단위로는 지자체 및 N GO, 인근 주 민 등 이해관계자와 협력체계를 
구축하여 사업장 인근 유 역의 수자원 보호와 개선 을 위해 노력하고 
있습니다.
제품에 포함될 수 있는 유해물질과 생산현장에서 사용되는 화학물질이 
고객과 임직원의 건강과 환경에 미칠 수 있는 부정적인 영향을 최소화하기 
위해 RoHS(EU 전기전자제품 내 우려물질 사용제한 지침) 과 REACH(EU 
화학물질의 등록, 평가, 허가, 제한 제도), TSCA(미국 독성물질관리법) 등 
글로벌 환경 기준을 반영해 사내 규칙을 제정하고 엄격하게 관리합니다.

위치하고 있는지 매년 검토하고, 수자원 리스크를 세분화해 분석합니다.

폐제품 수거 체계 운영 
DX부문은 한국을 포 함한 전 세계 70여 개국에서 브랜드에 관계 없이 
폐제품을 수거하기 위해 다양한 재활용 프로그램을 운영하고 있습니다. 
국가별 특성을 고려해 리사이클링센터를 직접 운영하거나 재활용 협회 
또는 재활용 업체와 협업해 폐전자제품 회수/재활용 프로그램을 운영하고 
있습니다.
2009년부터 2023년까지 누적 629.7만 톤의 폐전자제품을 회수했습니다. 
앞으로 2030년까지 제품을 판매하고 있는 모든 나라인 180여 개국으로 
폐제품 수거 체계를 확대하고, 2009년부터 누적으로 2030년 1,000만 톤, 
2050년 2,500만 톤의 폐전자제품을 수거할 계획입니다.
제품 수명 연장 활동
제품의 교체 주기가 짧 아질수록 소모되는 자원도, 배출되는 탄소도 
늘어나기에 우리 제품이 환경에 미치는 영향을 고려해 제품을 더 오래 쓸 
수 있는 방법을 연구하고 적용합니다. 내구성, 수리 용이성, 소프트웨어 
업그레이드 외에도 미국 CRN(Certified Re-Newed) 프로그램
1)
을 
통해 제품 수명 연장에 기여하고 있습니다.
1) 운영국가 : 미국, 영국, 프랑스(2024년 3월 기준)
자원 재활용 기술 연구
DX부문은 자원순환 극대화를 위해 2022년 7월 소재 재활용 및 기술과 
제품 적용을 연구하는 조직인 ‘순환경제연구소 ’를 설립 했습니다. 
순환경제연구소는 재활용 소재 개발, 폐기물 자원화 기술 연구 등을 통해

reference: The global privacy policy establishment involves operating Samsung's privacy website, managing personal information legal systems, and providing education, which aligns with the broader Compliance Program Management System (CPMS) that includes risk-based management, education and reporting programs, and corruption risk reviews. response: The global privacy policy establishment is part of Samsung Electronics' information protection and security efforts, which include operating a Compliance Program Management System (CPMS) for risk management. The CPMS provides a foundation for managing compliance risks by overseeing education, reporting programs, and corruption risk reviews. By establishing global privacy policies and operating platforms like the Samsung Privacy website, Samsung ensures transparent and secure handling of personal information. This aligns with the CPMS's role in systematically managing compliance risks, thereby ensuring that privacy practices comply with legal and ethical standards and contribute to overall risk management and compliance within the company.

reference: Samsung Electronics has structured its sustainability reporting by incorporating the EU disclosure standards known as ESRS (European Sustainability Reporting Standards). They started with 92 subtopics from ESRS and added 23 industry-specific issues, creating a total pool of 115 issues. These were evaluated against four criteria—alignment with company strategy, connection to global initiatives, relevance to industry peers, and value chain analysis—resulting in 52 prioritized issues. These 52 issues were then grouped into 13 overarching themes based on ESRS classifications. In the CEO's message, it is explained that despite challenging macroeconomic conditions such as high interest rates, inflation, and geopolitical issues, Samsung invested a record 28.3 trillion KRW in research and development and 53.1 trillion KRW in strategic facilities to strengthen technological leadership and prepare for long-term demand. The CEO highlights that sustainability management is evolving rapidly in response to global non-financial disclosure frameworks, including the EU's CSRD and regulations like the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) and battery regulations. Additionally, new EU laws on supply chain due diligence, such as the German Supply Chain Act and the upcoming EU CSDDD, emphasize human rights and labor conditions, which Samsung is actively addressing as part of its sustainable future efforts.
response:
Samsung Electronics addresses the EU Sustainability Reporting Standards (ESRS) by conducting a comprehensive materiality assessment based on the guidelines from the European Financial Reporting Advisory Group (EFRAG). They incorporate ESRS requirements by designing evaluation criteria and conducting assessments with broad stakeholder participation. Samsung first identified 115 ESG issues, including 23 industry-specific ones, then narrowed them down to 52 and finally selected 13 primary topics aligned with ESRS classifications. They analyze environmental, social, and governance impacts and financial risks/opportunities related to these topics, reflecting the characteristics of their different business divisions (DX and DS). The final material topics are reviewed by management and reported to the Sustainability Management Committee under the board of directors.

Regarding the CEO's message, it highlights that despite challenging macroeconomic conditions such as high interest rates, inflation, geopolitical issues, and industry competition, Samsung Electronics has made significant investments in research and development (28.3 trillion KRW) and strategic facilities (53.1 trillion KRW) to strengthen technological leadership and prepare for mid-to-long-term demand. The CEO acknowledges the evolving global non-financial disclosure requirements, including the IFRS Foundation's sustainability standards, EU's Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD), and the US SEC climate disclosure rules, marking the era of mandatory ESG information disclosure.

Specifically, the CEO points out that environmental regulations like the EU Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) and the EU battery regulations are intensifying, alongside human rights and labor environment management laws such as Germany's Supply Chain Due Diligence Act (effective 2023) and the upcoming EU Supply Chain Due Diligence Directive (CSDDD) in May 2024. These regulations have heightened the focus on sustainability and human rights in supply chains. Samsung Electronics is responding to these regulatory trends by continuing efforts toward a sustainable future, integrating these considerations into their management strategies and investment decisions even amid difficult economic times.

SASB(Sustainability Accounting Standards Board) 기준을 참고하여

이 외에도 삼성전자는 평가 과정에 이해관계자의 의견을 폭넓게 수용하기

영향을 모두 고려하였습니다.
중대성 평가 프로세스

사업에 대한 이해 단계에서는 대내외 환경 분석, 밸류체인 분석, 1차 주제

Message from 
Our CEO
주주, 고객, 협력회사, 그리고 임직원 여러분,
2023년은 고금리와 인플레이션, 지정학적 이슈 등 매우 불확실한 
거시경제 환경과 함께, 메모리 산업 부진과 다양한 제품군에서의 경쟁 
심화로 삼성전자에게 매우 어려운 한 해였습니다. 이토록 대내외적으로 
어려운 환경에서도 지속 성장의 기반 마련을 위해 역대 최고 수준의 28.3
조원을 연구개발에 투자하고, 53.1조원 수준의 전략적 시설투자로 기술 
리더십을 강화하며 중장기 수요에 미리 대응할 수 있었던 것은 삼성전자를 
아껴주시는 이해관계자 여러분의 관심과 격려 덕분입니다. 다시 한 번 
깊이 감사 드립니다.
급격한 변화를 겪고 있는 경제 상황에 맞춰, 기업의 지속가능경영 
분야에서도 많은 변화가 일어나고 있습니다. 특히 기업의 지속가능경영 
활동 정보 공개는 글로벌 비재무정보 공시 제도의 확산에 맞춰, 새로운 
국면을 맞고 있습니다. 국제회계기준재단(IFRS Foundation)이 2023년 
6월 지속가능성 지표를 확정한 것을 시작으로, EU의 지속가능성 보고지침
(CSRD)과 미국 증권거래위원회(SEC) 기후공시 기준 역시 세부 내용을 
순차적으로 확정하며 ESG 정보의 의무 공시 시대가 열리고 있습니다.
이와 함께, EU 탄소국경조정제도(CBAM)와 EU 배터리규제 등을 통한 
환경규제 역시 지속 강화되는 추세이고, 독일에서는 공급망의 인권과 
근로환경 관리를 의무화하는 공급망실사법이 2023년 발효되었으며, 
2024년 5월 EU 공급망 실사지침(CSDDD)이 확정되는 등 인권 분야에 
대한 관심 또한 지속 고조되고 있습니다. 
삼성전자는 이러한 추세에 맞춰 지속가능한 미래를 위한 노력을 계속해']

reference: In 2022, the Brazil manufacturing site completed a 100% transition to renewable energy by purchasing Renewable Energy Certificates (REC). Similarly, the South Korea DX division achieved 100% renewable energy usage by installing and operating solar power facilities at the Suwon site. Additionally, the Gumi and Gwangju sites in South Korea proactively introduced onsite renewable energy Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) to supply solar-generated electricity. Looking ahead, both Brazil and other Latin American manufacturing sites are continuously exploring renewable energy PPAs and aim to achieve 100% renewable energy targets by 2025. The South Korea DX division also plans to maintain and expand its 100% renewable energy goals across all its sites.
response:
In 2022, the Brazil manufacturing site completed its transition to 100% renewable energy by purchasing Renewable Energy Certificates (REC). Similarly, the South Korea DX division achieved 100% renewable energy usage at the Suwon site by installing and operating solar power facilities. Additionally, the Gumi and Gwangju sites in South Korea proactively introduced renewable energy Power Purchase Agreements (PPA) to supply electricity generated from solar power.

For future plans, both Brazil and South Korea are continuously exploring and expanding renewable energy PPAs. Brazil and Mexico manufacturing sites plan to pursue achieving 100% renewable energy goals by 2025. The South Korea DX division aims to convert all its business sites to 100% renewable energy by 2027, utilizing various procurement methods including expanding PPAs and installing solar power facilities on available site areas to improve both the quality and quantity of renewable energy sourcing.

reference: The 탄소중립위원회, chaired by the manufacturing and technology leader, makes decisions on detailed strategies to continuously advance environmental initiatives within the DS부문. This committee operates alongside the 지속가능경영위원회, which is the highest decision-making body under the board of directors overseeing sustainability management, including environmental strategies and goals across the company. The DS부문 also has an ESG경영협의회 led by the division head that reviews environmental management strategies, goals, and performance. Together, these bodies form a governance structure where the 지속가능경영위원회 approves and supervises environmental management strategies and major activities, the ESG경영협의회 reviews and monitors these strategies and outcomes, and the 탄소중립위원회 executes detailed decision-making and task implementation. This integrated system ensures that carbon neutrality goals, such as achieving Scope 1 and 2 carbon neutrality by 2050 for the DS부문, are systematically pursued with oversight, strategic alignment, and performance evaluation.
response:
Within the DS부문, the 탄소중립위원회, 지속가능경영위원회, and ESG경영협의회 collaborate closely to ensure the implementation and oversight of environmental management strategies and carbon neutrality goals through a structured governance and decision-making framework:

1. 지속가능경영위원회: This committee, under the board of directors and composed of outside directors, meets at least quarterly to oversee the direction and performance of sustainability management, including environmental management across the entire company, including DS부문. It approves environmental management strategies and goals and supervises major activities.

2. ESG경영협의회: Chaired by the DS부문 head, this council meets quarterly to discuss sustainability management issues with field leaders, reviewing environmental management strategies, goals, and performance specifically for DS부문.

3. 탄소중립위원회: Led by the head of management support, this committee meets bimonthly to deliberate on carbon-related matters, ensuring detailed decision-making on carbon neutrality initiatives.

Together, these bodies form a governance system where:

- The 지속가능경영위원회 sets the overall strategic direction and supervises performance at the highest level.

- The ESG경영협의회 reviews and coordinates environmental strategies and progress within DS부문.

- The 탄소중립위원회 focuses on carbon neutrality specifics, making detailed decisions and overseeing implementation.

Additionally, environmental working groups under these committees develop detailed tasks and monitor execution. The DS부문 integrates environmental performance into executive evaluations, linking results to incentives, thereby strengthening the environmental management system and advancing carbon neutrality goals.

reference: In March 2023, Samsung Electronics established the subsidiary 'Hope Star Forest,' a certified workplace for people with developmental disabilities, where these individuals produce baked goods such as cookies and muffins provided to Samsung Electronics employees. This initiative marks the beginning of providing stable employment opportunities for people with developmental disabilities, starting in the baking sector. Additionally, Samsung Electronics expanded its labor environment management scope to include second-tier manufacturing partners based on risk analysis and non-manufacturing sectors within its supply chain management. The company’s 2023 sustainability report was structured to align with global disclosure regulatory frameworks, thoroughly communicating key sustainability issues, management systems, strategies, and implementation activities. Samsung Electronics regards sustainability as an unwavering indicator for its future direction and a driving force for business competitiveness and technological innovation, especially amid environmental, social, economic risks, and geopolitical uncertainties. These initiatives demonstrate Samsung’s commitment to integrating social responsibility and risk management into its corporate governance and sustainable growth strategy.
response:
In March 2023, Samsung Electronics undertook several significant sustainability initiatives reflecting its comprehensive approach to managing social and environmental risks:

1. Environmental Initiatives:
   - The DS division installed 16 new process gas treatment facilities (RCS) across 4 production lines to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
   - Expanded the application of LNG waste heat recovery systems to further lower emissions.
   - Achieved "Platinum" certification from the Alliance for Water Stewardship (AWS) for its Giheung/Hwaseong, Pyeongtaek, and Xi'an plants, demonstrating excellence in water resource management.
   - Obtained additional recognition from the Ministry of Environment for 9 items, including wafer boxes, as recycled resources, increasing the total recognized recycled resource items to 49, with plans to expand annually.

2. Social Initiatives:
   - In April 2024, Samsung established a global grievance policy linked to its global human rights principles announced in February 2023, including operating grievance channels and setting standards for handling received grievances.
   - Strengthened supply chain management by analyzing risks and focusing on second-tier manufacturing partners in non-manufacturing sectors.

These initiatives illustrate Samsung Electronics' integrated approach to sustainability by addressing both environmental challenges—such as greenhouse gas reduction, water management, and resource circulation—and social responsibilities, including human rights and supply chain risk management. This comprehensive strategy demonstrates the company's commitment to mitigating risks and leveraging opportunities in environmental and social domains to support a sustainable future.

reference: In 2022년, DX부문 managed 우려물질 by strengthening compliance and control of regulated substances in products and chemical substances at business sites. They conducted risk assessments on all operations and facilities handling hazardous materials whenever new equipment was installed or changes were made to personnel, process layout, or work procedures. After identifying risks, they analyzed the likelihood, consequences, influencing factors, and control measures, predicting possible accident scenarios and impacts. For water use, DX부문 installed water-saving facilities at all sites, treated wastewater to produce reclaimed water, and sought additional reuse applications to reduce water intake and increase reuse rates. They also utilized groundwater and rainwater for landscaping and domestic use. As a result, water intake decreased by 8% compared to 2022, with a reuse volume of 3,470 thousand tons and a 3% increase in reuse rate compared to 2022.
response:
In 2022, DX부문 managed 우려물질 (concern substances) and water use through several measures:

1. 우려물질 Management:
- DX부문 strengthened compliance and management of concern substances in products and chemical substances used in workplaces.
- They conducted risk assessments for all operations and facilities handling hazardous/risky substances when installing new equipment or changing personnel, process layout, work procedures, or conditions.
- They analyzed risks considering the likelihood, consequences, influencing factors, and control measures, predicting possible accident scenarios and impacts.
- They managed chemical substances from purchase to disposal through a system to ensure safety.
- They enforced strict internal rules reflecting global environmental standards such as RoHS, REACH, and TSCA.
- They encouraged suppliers to participate actively in environmental management through Eco Partner certification audits and required submission of product environmental certificates proving concern substance information.

2. Water Use Management:
- DX부문 installed water-saving facilities at all workplaces and treated wastewater to find additional reuse applications, reducing water intake and increasing reuse rates.
- They utilized groundwater and rainwater for landscaping and living water, promoting various water-saving activities.
- In 2022, water intake decreased by 8% compared to the previous year, saving 1,553 thousand tons.
- Water reuse increased by 3% compared to 2022, reaching 3,470 thousand tons.
- They obtained the highest 'Platinum' certification from the Alliance for Water Stewardship (AWS) for water management excellence at their Suwon, Gumi, and Gwangju sites.
- They planned to expand AWS certification to overseas sites like Vietnam in 2024.
- They set a goal for 2030 to achieve 100% water resource replenishment by returning the amount of water consumed back to local communities through water resource replenishment projects.

Overall, DX부문 implemented systematic risk management for hazardous substances and comprehensive water resource management, including reduction, reuse, and replenishment, to minimize environmental impact and ensure safety in 2022.

reference: In 2022년, 삼성전자 DX부문 announced a new environmental management strategy aiming to achieve carbon neutrality by 2030 through eliminating direct and indirect carbon emissions (Scope 1 and 2). They plan to minimize direct greenhouse gas emissions by improving energy efficiency in processes and expanding the use of renewable energy. Additionally, they are pursuing various greenhouse gas reduction initiatives across the entire value chain, including logistics, sales, and product usage. Meanwhile, the DS부문 declared carbon neutrality by 2050 (Scope 1 and 2) as part of the same 2022 environmental strategy. They are strengthening carbon reduction execution by applying greenhouse gas treatment and energy efficiency technologies and collaborating with government and industry projects. Furthermore, DS부문 integrates climate-related regulatory risks and opportunities from different countries into the company-wide risk management system. These risks and opportunities, which may impact business and reputation, are monitored and reported to management through environmental management councils.
response:
삼성전자 DX부문과 DS부문은 2022년 신환경경영전략에 따라 각각 다음과 같이 탄소중립 목표와 리스크 관리에 대응하였습니다.

DX부문:
- 탄소중립 목표: 2030년까지 직·간접(Scope 1, 2) 탄소 순배출을 제로화하는 탄소중립을 달성할 계획입니다.
- 추진방향: 공정 에너지 효율 제고를 통해 온실가스 직접배출을 최소화하고 재생 에너지 사용을 확대하며, 제품의 물류, 판매, 사용 등 전 밸류체인에 걸쳐 다양한 온실가스 감축 과제를 추진하고 있습니다.
- 리스크 관리: 기후변화 관련 리스크의 실질적인 재무적 또는 전략적 영향을 규명하고, 이슈의 중요도와 사업에 미치는 영향에 따라 대응전략을 수립하여 의사 결정에 반영합니다. 리스크는 글로벌 기후체제, 지역별 규제 강화, 시장 변화, 이해관계자 요구사항, 물리적 환경 변화 등을 포함합니다. 특히 국내 제조사업장은 배출권거래제 기반으로 온실가스 배출량 관리 및 법적 의무를 이행하고 있으며, 온실가스 감축목표가 점차 강화될 것으로 예상합니다. 단기적으로는 탄소배출권 가격 상승, 에너지 고효율 기술 도입에 따른 투자비 증가, 기상이변 대응 투자, 복구비용 증가를 리스크로 보고, 외부 탄소배출권 확보와 에너지 고효율 설비 도입에 따른 비용 절감을 기회요인으로 인식합니다. 중기적으로는 소비자들의 친환경 제품 선호를 기회요인으로 보고, 기온 상승 및 수자원 고갈 등 물리적 영향을 장기적 리스크로 예상합니다.

DS부문:
- 탄소중립 목표: 2050년 탄소중립(Scope 1, 2)을 선언하였습니다.
- 추진방향: 온실가스 처리 및 에너지 효율화 기술 적용, 정부 및 산업계 간 협력 등 다양한 프로젝트를 통해 탄소감축 실행력을 강화하고 있습니다.
- 리스크 관리: 기후변화 관련 국가별 규제 리스크와 기회를 파악하여 전사 리스크 관리 체계에 통합하여 관리합니다. 주요 물리적 리스크 요인으로 폭염, 태풍, 해안침수가 도출되었으며, 특히 태풍에 대비해 시설 건설 시 내풍 기준을 역대 최고 풍속 수준으로 수립하고 차수막을 설치하였습니다. 전환 리스크로는 온실가스 배출량 증가에 따른 비용 증가가 주요 리스크로 식별되어, 이를 저감하기 위해 공정가스 처리시설(RCS)을 신규 증설하는 등 지속 투자하고 있습니다.

요약하면, DX부문은 2030년 탄소중립을 목표로 전 밸류체인에서 온실가스 감축과 재생에너지 확대에 집중하며, 리스크를 재무적·전략적 측면에서 관리하고 있습니다. DS부문은 2050년 탄소중립을 목표로 기술 적용과 협력을 통해 탄소감축을 추진하며, 국가별 규제와 물리적 리스크를 통합 관리하고 있습니다.

리스크 관리
DX부문은 기후변화와 관련된 리스 크의 실질적인 재무적 또는 전략적

규제 강화, 시장의 변화, 이해관계자 요구사 항, 물리적 환경 변화 등을 
포함합니다. 특히, 국내 제조사업장은 배출권거래제 기반으로 온실가스

추진방향
DX부문은 글로벌 20여개 제조사업장의 제조공정에서 용수 재이용률을 
높이기 위해 사용한 물을 오수, 폐수, 공정용수, 초순수로 분류하여 매월 
항목별 재사용 실적을 산출하고 취 수량 절감을 추진합니다. 더 나아가 
사업장에서 자연으로 돌려 보내지 못하고 부득이하게 소모한 물은 수자원 
환원 사업을 통해 지역사회로 재공급하여 수자원을 보전하고자 합니다. 
또한 협력회사를 대상으로 RBA(Responsib le Business A lliance) 
평가를 진행하고 WASH(Water, Sanitation and Hygiene) 서비스 
점검과 수자원 처 리 시설 운영 개 선 컨설팅을 제공합니다. 각 사업장 
단위로는 지자체 및 N GO, 인근 주 민 등 이해관계자와 협력체계를 
구축하여 사업장 인근 유 역의 수자원 보호와 개선 을 위해 노력하고 
있습니다.
제품에 포함될 수 있는 유해물질과 생산현장에서 사용되는 화학물질이 
고객과 임직원의 건강과 환경에 미칠 수 있는 부정적인 영향을 최소화하기 
위해 RoHS(EU 전기전자제품 내 우려물질 사용제한 지침) 과 REACH(EU 
화학물질의 등록, 평가, 허가, 제한 제도), TSCA(미국 독성물질관리법) 등 
글로벌 환경 기준을 반영해 사내 규칙을 제정하고 엄격하게 관리합니다.

제품 및 제조과정 우려물질 관리 
DX부문은 에 코파트너 인증 심사를 통해 공급망의 오염물질 사용을 
관리하여 협력회사들 이 환경경영 활동에 적극 참여할 수 있도록 
독려하고 있습니다. 협력회사는 원재료  업체에서 받 은 데이터와 
우려물질 정보를 증명하는 제품환경보증서 등을 삼성전자에 제출합니다. 
삼성전자는 ‘제품환경 관리물질 운영규 칙’ 준수 여부와 협력회사 
환경품질관리시스 템을 심사해 인증자격을 부여하고, 인증을 취득 한 
협력회사에 한해 거래하고 있습니다.
제품 내 우려물질 관리 
수자원 환원 사업 추진
DX부문의 제품 생산과정에는 물이 필수적으로 사용되고 사용된 물은 
깨끗하게 정화하여 다시 자연으로 돌려 보내지만 필연적으로 일부의 물은 
소모되게 됩니다. DX부문은 소모한 물의 양만큼 지역사회에 돌려주는 
‘2030년 수자원 환원 100%’라는 목표를 수립했습니다. 이러한 수자원 
환원 프로젝트를 통해 이해관계자, 지역사회에 가용 수자원을 돌려주어 
환경 영향을 최소화 하고 있습니다. 2023년 한국농어촌공사와 업무협약
(MOU)을 체결 하여 물 부족 을 겪는 도서지역에 농업용수 재이용을 
지원하는 시범사업을 진행했고, 2024년에는 국내 뿐만 아니라 해외 제조 
사업장에서도 환원 사업을 발굴하여 수자원 보전에 기여할 계획입니다. 
DX부문 수자원 환원 현황 
오염물질 배출 최소화와 사고 대비
DX부문은 제품 생산과정에서 발생하는 대기, 수질 오염물질의 배출을 
최소화 하기 위해,  법적기준 및 엄격한 내부기준을 적용하고 있으며 각 
제조사업장 대기 배출구 및 폐수 방류수 분석을 법적 기준보다 더 자주 
수행하여 자체 기준 준수 여부를 지속적으로 관리합니다. 
또한 대기, 수질 오염물질 방지시설의 여유  용량을 상시 10%  이상', "대한 관심 또한 지속 고조되고 있습니다. 
삼성전자는 이러한 추세에 맞춰 지속가능한 미래를 위한 노력을 계속해 
왔습니다. 2050년 탄소중립을 통해 글로벌 기후위기 극복 노력에 
동참하고, 자원의 순환성을 극대화하여 순환경제 구축 에 기여하며, 
기술혁신을 통해 환경난제 해결에 도전하는 내용의 '新환경경영전략'을 
2022년 9월에 발표하였습니다. 
2030년 탄소중립을 목표로 하는 DX부문에서는 미국, 유럽, 중국에 이어 
한국, 베트남, 인도, 브라 질을 포함한 글로벌 주요 제조사업장의 사용 
전력을 재생에너지로 100% 전환하였으며, 2023년말 기준, 총 93.4%
의 재생에너지 전환 실적을 기록하였습니다. 또한 자원순환형 소재 확대 
로드맵에 맞춰, 당사가 구매한 제품 내 플라스틱 부품 25%에 재생레진을 
적용하였습니다. 
DS부문에서는 2050년 탄소중립 달성을 위해 2023년 공정가스 처리시설
(RCS) 16대를 4개 라인에 신규 설치하고, LNG 폐열 회수 시스템을 확대 
적용하여 온실가스 배출 저감을 위해 노력했습니다. 또한 2030년까지 
용수 취수량을 2021년 수준으로 절 감하는 것을 목 표로 하고 있으며, 
국제수자원관리동맹(AWS)으로부터 기흥/화성, 평택, 중국 시안 사업장에 
대해 최고 등급인 ' 플래티넘' 인증을 획득하여 수자원 관리 체계의 
우수성을 입증 받았습니다. 아울러, 폐기물 발생량 저감을 위해 2024년 
3월, 웨이퍼박스 등 9건에 대해 환경부 순환자원 인정을 추가 취득하여 
현재까지 총 49건을 순환자원으로 인정받았고 매년 품목을 확대해나가고 
있습니다.
사회 분야에서는 지난 2023년 2월 발표한 글로벌 인권원칙에 연계하여, 
글로벌 고충처리 정책 을 2024년 4월 제정, 고충  접수 채널 운영과 
접수된 고충의 처리 원칙에 대한 기준을 수립하였고, 공급망 관리에 
있어서는 비제조 분야 및 리스크 분석에 따라 제조 분야 2차 협력회사로"]

reference: DX부문 manages 온실가스 risks by identifying the financial and strategic impacts of climate-related risks such as global climate regimes, regional regulatory strengthening, market changes, stakeholder demands, and physical environmental changes. They comply with legal obligations for 온실가스 emission management, calculation, and emission permit submission under the emission trading system, especially in domestic manufacturing sites. They recognize short-term risks like rising carbon permit prices, increased investment costs for energy-efficient technologies, and costs related to climate anomaly responses, while seeing opportunities in securing external carbon permits and energy cost savings through high-efficiency equipment. Mid-term opportunities include changes in consumer patterns favoring eco-friendly products, and long-term risks include temperature rise and water resource depletion. For 온실가스 직접배출 감축, DX부문 plans a mid-to-long-term roadmap including replacing high-efficiency equipment, applying IoT systems for automation, optimizing heating and cooling operations to save energy, collaborating with global reduction project experts, securing external reduction permits through afforestation and mangrove projects, improving LNG usage efficiency, and overall energy use reduction at business sites. They aim to achieve carbon neutrality (Scope 1, 2) by 2030 through these direct emission reduction activities and energy-saving measures.

reference: According to Samsung Electronics' 2024 sustainability report, the company plans to achieve 탄소중립 (carbon neutrality) by 2030 by eliminating direct and indirect carbon emissions (Scope 1 and 2). To accomplish this, they aim to minimize direct greenhouse gas emissions through improving energy efficiency in their processes and expanding the use of renewable energy. Additionally, they are implementing various greenhouse gas reduction initiatives across the entire value chain, including logistics, sales, and product usage beyond their business sites.
response:
According to Samsung Electronics' 2024 sustainability report, the company plans to achieve 탄소중립 (carbon neutrality) by 2030 through the following measures:

1. For the DX division, they aim to achieve carbon neutrality (Scope 1 and 2) by 2030 by minimizing direct greenhouse gas emissions through improving process energy efficiency and expanding the use of renewable energy. They have already converted 100% of the electricity used in major global manufacturing sites, including the US, Europe, China, Korea, Vietnam, India, and Brazil, to renewable energy, achieving a 93.4% renewable energy transition rate as of the end of 2023.

2. They are implementing various greenhouse gas reduction projects across the entire value chain, including product logistics, sales, and usage.

3. The DS division is working towards carbon neutrality by 2050, with efforts such as installing 16 new process gas treatment facilities and expanding LNG waste heat recovery systems to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

4. Samsung Electronics has established a new environmental management strategy announced in September 2022, which includes these carbon neutrality goals and related initiatives.

5. The company is investing over 7 trillion KRW by 2030 in environmental management tasks such as reducing process gases and conserving water resources.

6. They operate a company-wide environmental management task force and carbon neutrality committee to execute these initiatives.

Overall, Samsung Electronics is focusing on direct emission reductions, expanding renewable energy use, and engaging in external greenhouse gas reduction projects to achieve carbon neutrality by 2030.

AWS 인증은 안정적인 물 관리, 수질오염물질 관리, 수질 위생, 유역 내 수생태계 영향, 거버넌스 구축 등 총 100개 항목을 평가하여 부여됩니다. 또한, DX부문은 모든 제조사업장에서 폐기물 매립 제로 인증 취득을 목표로 하여 기존 매립 및 소각하던 폐기물을 시멘트 원료, 재생 연료 등으로 재활용하고, 신규 폐기물 선별 프로세스를 구축해 재활용 가능한 폐기물 선별을 극대화했습니다. 재활용이 불가능한 폐기물은 소각 시 열과 스팀 등의 에너지를 회수하는 등 재활용률을 높여 2025년까지 폐기물 매립 제로 최고등급인 플래티넘 인증을 취득할 계획입니다.
response:
Based on the provided context from 삼성전자 지속가능경영보고서 2024, 삼성전자 DX부문 has achieved high standards in both water resource management and waste landfill zero initiatives through the following approaches:

1. Water Resource Management:
- DX부문 operates global manufacturing sites with a focus on increasing the reuse rate of water by classifying used water into categories such as wastewater, process water, and ultrapure water, and tracking monthly reuse performance.
- They have set a goal of "100% water resource replenishment by 2030," meaning that the amount of water consumed is returned to local communities through water replenishment projects.
- They collaborate with local governments, NGOs, and stakeholders to protect and improve water resources in areas near their manufacturing sites.
- They conduct risk assessments annually to identify water stress or water risk areas and apply international water management standards like the World Resources Institute's Aqueduct Water Risk Atlas.
- They provide consulting and evaluations for suppliers to improve water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) services and water treatment facilities.

2. Waste Landfill Zero Initiatives:
- DX부문 has established policies aimed at zero landfill waste by increasing waste recycling.
- They plan to obtain the "Waste Landfill Zero Certification" from the global environmental safety certification body UL for all manufacturing sites.
- The goal is to achieve the highest level (Platinum) certification by 2025 for all DX부문 manufacturing sites.

Through these comprehensive management systems, strict internal standards, collaboration with external organizations, and continuous monitoring and improvement, 삼성전자 DX부문 has achieved the 플래티넘 certification in both water resource management and waste landfill zero initiatives.

관리하여 협력회사들 이 환경경영 활동에 적극 참여할 수 있도록 
독려하고 있습니다. 협력회사는 원재료  업체에서 받 은 데이터와 
우려물질 정보를 증명하는 제품환경보증서 등을 삼성전자에 제출합니다. 
삼성전자는 ‘제품환경 관리물질 운영규 칙’ 준수 여부와 협력회사 
환경품질관리시스 템을 심사해 인증자격을 부여하고, 인증을 취득 한 
협력회사에 한해 거래하고 있습니다.

수자원 환원 사업 추진
DX부문의 제품 생산과정에는 물이 필수적으로 사용되고 사용된 물은 
깨끗하게 정화하여 다시 자연으로 돌려 보내지만 필연적으로 일부의 물은 
소모되게 됩니다. DX부문은 소모한 물의 양만큼 지역사회에 돌려주는 
‘2030년 수자원 환원 100%’라는 목표를 수립했습니다. 이러한 수자원 
환원 프로젝트를 통해 이해관계자, 지역사회에 가용 수자원을 돌려주어 
환경 영향을 최소화 하고 있습니다. 2023년 한국농어촌공사와 업무협약
(MOU)을 체결 하여 물 부족 을 겪는 도서지역에 농업용수 재이용을 
지원하는 시범사업을 진행했고, 2024년에는 국내 뿐만 아니라 해외 제조 
사업장에서도 환원 사업을 발굴하여 수자원 보전에 기여할 계획입니다.

reference: The company prioritizes minimizing its own greenhouse gas direct emissions by improving energy efficiency, reducing energy use, and transitioning energy sources at its business sites. It also identifies and implements greenhouse gas reduction projects to offset emissions that cannot be reduced internally. For 2023, the company secured 250,000 tons of external reduction credits through projects like forest agriculture and mangrove creation in India and Indonesia, which also improve local residents' quality of life and income. Looking ahead, the company plans to continue its internal reduction activities and discover external reduction projects to achieve carbon neutrality. Specifically, by 2027, the company aims to convert 100% of its domestic work vehicles to zero-emission vehicles, including electric and hydrogen vehicles.
response:
The company plans to reduce greenhouse gas direct emissions by prioritizing energy efficiency, energy saving, and energy transition activities at its business sites to minimize its own emissions. It also identifies and implements greenhouse gas reduction projects to offset emissions that cannot be reduced through internal efforts. The company sets reduction targets based on the previous year's energy usage for its global manufacturing sites and continuously pursues energy-saving activities. Specific measures include replacing high-efficiency equipment, optimizing heating and cooling operations, collaborating with global reduction project experts, securing external reduction emission rights through afforestation and mangrove projects, and improving LNG usage efficiency.

Regarding the specific goal for 2027 about domestic work vehicles, the company plans to convert 100% of its domestic work vehicles to zero-emission vehicles (electric/hydrogen vehicles) by 2027.

reference: In 2022년, the DX부문 managed environmental risks by conducting risk assessments on all operations and facilities handling hazardous substances whenever new equipment was installed or changes were made to personnel, processes, or working conditions. They analyzed risks by considering the likelihood, consequences, influencing factors, and control measures, and predicted possible accident scenarios and their impacts. Additionally, the DX부문 implemented systematic water resource management by installing water-saving facilities at all sites, treating wastewater to produce reclaimed water, and discovering additional reuse applications. These efforts led to an 8% reduction in water intake and a 3% increase in water reuse rate compared to 2022년, with 1,553 thousand tons of water saved and 3,470 thousand tons of water reused.
response:
In 2022, the DX부문 managed environmental risks and water use through several key actions:

1. Water Use and Reuse:
- They classified used water into categories such as wastewater, process water, and ultrapure water, and calculated monthly reuse performance by category to promote water intake reduction.
- Installed water-saving facilities at all business sites and treated wastewater to find additional reuse destinations, thereby reducing water intake and increasing reuse rates.
- Utilized groundwater and rainwater for landscaping and living water, promoting various water-saving activities.
- Achieved an 8% reduction in water intake compared to 2022 and a 3% increase in water reuse rate.

2. Water Risk Management:
- Annually reviewed whether business sites were located in water-stressed or water-risk areas, using international water management standards like the World Resources Institute's Aqueduct Water Risk Atlas.
- Obtained the highest 'Platinum' certification from the Alliance for Water Stewardship (AWS) for water management excellence at sites in Suwon, Gumi, and Gwangju in February 2024, demonstrating advanced water management practices.

3. Environmental Risk and Hazardous Substance Management:
- Implemented strict management of hazardous substances in products and manufacturing processes, complying with global environmental standards such as RoHS, REACH, and TSCA.
- Conducted risk assessments for all hazardous/risky substances handled in new equipment installations or process changes.
- Minimized emissions of air and water pollutants by applying legal and internal standards, frequently analyzing emissions and effluents beyond legal requirements.
- Managed chemical substances safely from purchase to disposal through a strengthened chemical management process.

4. Water Resource Restoration:
- Established a goal of 100% water resource restoration by 2030, returning the amount of water consumed back to local communities through water resource restoration projects.
- In 2023, signed an MOU with the Korea Rural Community Corporation to support agricultural water reuse in water-scarce island areas and planned to expand restoration projects domestically and internationally.

These comprehensive efforts in 2022 reflect DX부문's commitment to managing environmental risks and sustainable water use.

제품 및 제조과정 우려물질 관리 
DX부문은 에 코파트너 인증 심사를 통해 공급망의 오염물질 사용을 
관리하여 협력회사들 이 환경경영 활동에 적극 참여할 수 있도록 
독려하고 있습니다. 협력회사는 원재료  업체에서 받 은 데이터와 
우려물질 정보를 증명하는 제품환경보증서 등을 삼성전자에 제출합니다. 
삼성전자는 ‘제품환경 관리물질 운영규 칙’ 준수 여부와 협력회사 
환경품질관리시스 템을 심사해 인증자격을 부여하고, 인증을 취득 한 
협력회사에 한해 거래하고 있습니다.
제품 내 우려물질 관리 
수자원 환원 사업 추진
DX부문의 제품 생산과정에는 물이 필수적으로 사용되고 사용된 물은 
깨끗하게 정화하여 다시 자연으로 돌려 보내지만 필연적으로 일부의 물은 
소모되게 됩니다. DX부문은 소모한 물의 양만큼 지역사회에 돌려주는 
‘2030년 수자원 환원 100%’라는 목표를 수립했습니다. 이러한 수자원 
환원 프로젝트를 통해 이해관계자, 지역사회에 가용 수자원을 돌려주어 
환경 영향을 최소화 하고 있습니다. 2023년 한국농어촌공사와 업무협약
(MOU)을 체결 하여 물 부족 을 겪는 도서지역에 농업용수 재이용을 
지원하는 시범사업을 진행했고, 2024년에는 국내 뿐만 아니라 해외 제조 
사업장에서도 환원 사업을 발굴하여 수자원 보전에 기여할 계획입니다. 
DX부문 수자원 환원 현황 
오염물질 배출 최소화와 사고 대비
DX부문은 제품 생산과정에서 발생하는 대기, 수질 오염물질의 배출을 
최소화 하기 위해,  법적기준 및 엄격한 내부기준을 적용하고 있으며 각 
제조사업장 대기 배출구 및 폐수 방류수 분석을 법적 기준보다 더 자주 
수행하여 자체 기준 준수 여부를 지속적으로 관리합니다. 
또한 대기, 수질 오염물질 방지시설의 여유  용량을 상시 10%  이상', '삼성전자 화학물질 관리 연혁 프로세스를 강화하여 운영하고 있습니다. 
화학물질 사용에 대한 안전성을 확보하기 위해 화학물질 구매부터 
폐기까지 모든 과정을 시스템으로 관리합니다.

reference: In 2023년, the DX division achieved 93.4% renewable energy usage and pursued the transition of all domestic business vehicles to 100% zero-emission vehicles (electric and hydrogen). For 2024년, the environmental goals include continuing the push for 100% renewable energy conversion at DX division sites, expanding water resource return projects domestically and internationally, and increasing the application of recycled resin in plastic parts of products to 25%. Additionally, the DX division aims to maintain and expand waste landfill zero certifications at all manufacturing sites and operate product take-back systems in over 70 countries worldwide.
response: In 2024, the DX division planned to achieve a 10% reduction in energy usage compared to the previous year as part of their greenhouse gas direct emission reduction goals. Building on their 2023 achievements, which included reaching 93.4% renewable energy use and progressing towards transitioning domestic business vehicles to 100% zero-emission (electric/hydrogen) vehicles by 2027, the division aimed to continue energy-saving activities such as replacing high-efficiency equipment, optimizing heating and cooling operations, and expanding greenhouse gas reduction projects. They also set a target to improve the energy efficiency of seven representative product models by an average of 30% by 2030.

폐제품 수거 체계 운영 
DX부문은 한국을 포 함한 전 세계 70여 개국에서 브랜드에 관계 없이 
폐제품을 수거하기 위해 다양한 재활용 프로그램을 운영하고 있습니다. 
국가별 특성을 고려해 리사이클링센터를 직접 운영하거나 재활용 협회 
또는 재활용 업체와 협업해 폐전자제품 회수/재활용 프로그램을 운영하고 
있습니다.
2009년부터 2023년까지 누적 629.7만 톤의 폐전자제품을 회수했습니다. 
앞으로 2030년까지 제품을 판매하고 있는 모든 나라인 180여 개국으로 
폐제품 수거 체계를 확대하고, 2009년부터 누적으로 2030년 1,000만 톤, 
2050년 2,500만 톤의 폐전자제품을 수거할 계획입니다.
제품 수명 연장 활동
제품의 교체 주기가 짧 아질수록 소모되는 자원도, 배출되는 탄소도 
늘어나기에 우리 제품이 환경에 미치는 영향을 고려해 제품을 더 오래 쓸 
수 있는 방법을 연구하고 적용합니다. 내구성, 수리 용이성, 소프트웨어 
업그레이드 외에도 미국 CRN(Certified Re-Newed) 프로그램

을

자원 재활용 기술 연구

DX부문은 2027년까지 모든 사업장의 사용 전력 100%를 재생에너지로 
전환하는 목표를 수립하였고 글로벌 시장에서 가용한 조 달 수단을 
활용하여 재생에너지 사용량을 지속 확대하고 있습니다. 또한 재생에너지 
전력구매계약(PPA, Power Purchase Agreement)의 점진적인 확대를 
통하여 장기적으로 재생에너지 공급원을 확보하고, 사업장 내 여유 부지에 
태양광 발전 설비를 설치하는 등 재생에너지 조달의 질적, 양적 개선을 
도모하고 있습니다.

reference: The company collaborates with NGOs and local communities by establishing cooperative frameworks with local governments, NGOs, and nearby residents to protect and improve water resources around its business sites. Specifically, the DX division increases water reuse rates at over 20 global manufacturing sites by categorizing used water into wastewater, process water, and ultrapure water, and tracks monthly reuse performance to reduce water intake. For water that cannot be returned to nature, the company implements water resource replenishment projects to supply water back to local communities, thereby conserving water resources. Additionally, the company conducts Responsible Business Alliance (RBA) evaluations for partner companies and provides consulting to improve water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) services and water treatment facility operations. These efforts are part of the company’s broader commitment to social responsibility, including human rights, environmental protection, and contributions to the UN Sustainable Development Goals, as coordinated through meetings with NGOs and stakeholder forums.
response:
The company engages in collaboration with NGOs and local communities through various activities such as NGO meetings, stakeholder forums, and citizen society-management meetings. These interactions allow the company to share its sustainability management achievements and understand the requests and concerns of European and global stakeholders. The company incorporates these opinions into its sustainability activities and continuously communicates the outcomes.

Specifically for water resource conservation, the company has expanded water resource return projects domestically and internationally, obtained AWS Platinum certifications for several sites, and plans to further expand certifications to overseas sites. It operates a product take-back system in over 70 countries and has achieved zero landfill waste certification at multiple manufacturing sites.

Through these collaborative efforts with NGOs and local communities, the company supports water resource conservation and advances its social responsibility initiatives by integrating stakeholder feedback, promoting transparency, and implementing sustainable practices across its operations.
